Gets a list of repositories metadata.

Azure REST API version: 2025-01-01-preview.

Other available API versions: 2023-03-01-preview, 2023-04-01-preview, 2023-05-01-preview, 2023-06-01-preview, 2023-07-01-preview, 2023-08-01-preview, 2023-09-01-preview, 2023-10-01-preview, 2023-12-01-preview, 2024-01-01-preview, 2024-04-01-preview, 2024-10-01-preview, 2025-03-01.

These versions are not included in the SDK but you can generate them as a local SDK package; see the [version guide](../../../version-guide/#accessing-any-api-version-via-local-packages) for details.




## Using listSourceControlRepositories {#using}

Two invocation forms are available. The direct form accepts plain
arguments and either blocks until the result value is available, or
returns a Promise-wrapped result. The output form accepts
Input-wrapped arguments and returns an Output-wrapped result.

    <dd>Application installation ID. Required when <code>kind</code> is <code>App</code>. Supported by <code>GitHub</code> only.</dd><dt class="property-optional"

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#installationid_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">installation<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The installation id of the repository.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="url_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#url_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">url</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The url to access the repository.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>
